meanings.definition: A thought occurring after the main thought or action.
meanings.sent1: Realizing he forgot his lunch was an afterthought after he left for work.
meanings.sent2: Her decision to study abroad was an afterthought, made quickly without much consideration.
meanings.sent3: The afterthought of bringing an umbrella only came to him when he was already drenched in the rain.
meanings.sent4: His apology felt like an afterthought, lacking sincerity and depth.
meanings.sent5: The afterthought of calling his friend to check on him nagged at the back of his mind.

meanings.sent1: The dessert was just an afterthought to the delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: The bonus features on the DVD felt like an afterthought, not enhancing the movie experience.
meanings.sent3: Adding the decorative bow as an afterthought made the gift look more festive.
meanings.sent4: The extra credit assignment seemed like an afterthought, thrown in at the last minute.
meanings.sent5: The afterthought of including a personal note in the card made it more special.
